alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey; Clinton; Lincoln; Russell; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 10:31AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lincoln, northeastern Clinton, Russell, east central Taylor, southern Casey and eastern Adair Counties through 1100 AM EDT/1000 AM CDT/... At 1031 AM EDT/931 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jamestown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Russell, east central Taylor, south central Lincoln, southern Casey, eastern Adair and northeastern Clinton Counties, including the following locations... Eli, Lawhorn Hill, Cundiff, Teddy, Royville, Sano, Gilpin, Evans Ford, Vinnie and Narvel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Casey; Clinton; Lincoln; Russell; Taylor
